title: regex! macro does not work
body:
AFACIT, `regex!` just doesn't work. Taking [the example from the docs](http://doc.rust-lang.org/regex/regex/index.html#the-regex!-macro),

```
#![feature(plugin)]
#![plugin(regex_macros)]
extern crate regex;

fn main() {
    let re = regex!(r"^\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2}$");
    assert_eq!(re.is_match("2014-01-01"), true);
}
```

And attempting to compile:

```
% rustc regex-test.rs
regex-test.rs:2:11: 2:23 error: can't find crate for `regex_macros`
regex-test.rs:2 #![plugin(regex_macros)]
                          ^~~~~~~~~~~~
error: aborting due to previous error
```

```
% rustc --version --verbose
rustc 1.0.0-nightly (425297a93 2015-03-11) (built 2015-03-12)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 425297a93035bc89663ff5f83d229f6c19341ffb
commit-date: 2015-03-11
build-date: 2015-03-12
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.0.0-nightly
```

Note that if I do this in a crate, I get a different error from `cargo`. I did `cargo new regextest`, and then edited `lib.rs` to be the following:

```
% cat lib.rs
#![feature(plugin)]
#![plugin(regex_macros)]
extern crate regex;


#[test]
fn it_works() {
    let regex = regex!("[0-9a-fA-F]{2}");
}
```

Attempting to run `cargo test`:

```
% cargo test
   Compiling regextest v0.0.1 (file:///home/roy/code/random/regextest)
lib.rs:2:11: 2:23 error: can't find crate for `regex_macros`
lib.rs:2:11: 2:23 error: can't find crate for `regex_macros`
lib.rs:2 #![plugin(regex_macros)]
lib.rs:2 #![plugin(regex_macros)]
                   ^~~~~~~~~~~~
                   ^~~~~~~~~~~~
error: aborting due to previous error
error: aborting due to previous error
Build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
Could not compile `regextest`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
```

```
% cargo --version
cargo 0.0.1-pre-nightly (66849de 2015-03-10) (built 2015-03-11)
```
